summary: This is an FBI internal request form from the Miami Division to the Records Management Division and Special Technologies and Applications Office, requesting scanning, automation, and data formatting assistance for telephone records related to the obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez. The document reveals Rodriguez, former house manager for Jeffrey Epstein, attempted to sell an address book believed to contain names and numbers of additional underage victims.

events.title: Timeframe for telephone records
events.description: Telephone records were generated between September 1, 2001, and the present (2010) for cases that may now be closed.

locations: Winchester, Virginia 22602 (DocLab - Telephone Application Audit Processing Team, 170 Marcel Drive)
keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez, Jeffrey Epstein's former house manager and butler, came into possession of an address book containing names and telephone numbers believed to be additional, previously unknown underage victims of Epstein.

Rodriguez attempted to sell the address book to an Undercover Employee (UCE) instead of turning it over to law enforcement or attorneys in response to federal subpoenas issued during pending civil litigation.
The FBI Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against Rodriguez in October 2009.

The document is a request for the FBI's Document Conversion Laboratory to scan and automate telephone records obtained from the address book, which are believed to belong to Epstein, his associates, or potential underage victims.
The records are to be processed and loaded into the Telephone Application (TA), the FBI's centralized repository for scanned and electronic intelligence information.
